function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of access to private outdoor space for people suffering from lung diseases, leading to potential health decline.","Impact":"Increased stress levels, limited ability to manage respiratory conditions, and higher risk of disease transmission.","Mitigation":"Providing alternatives such as balconies and terraces in apartment blocks, promoting natural ventilation, and advocating for outdoor space availability.","Technologies":"Natural ventilation systems, construction of balconies and terraces, air purification systems.","People":"People suffering from lung diseases, occupants of apartment blocks.","Owner":"Construction developers, building management, and public health organizations."},{"Description":"Increased consumption of resources in homes during extended lockdowns, leading to environmental impacts and resource strain.","Impact":"Elevated energy and water consumption, changes in waste generation, and anthropogenic impact on air, water, and soil systems.","Mitigation":"Promoting responsible consumption, energy-efficient practices, and sustainable waste management.","Technologies":"Energy-efficient appliances, water-saving fixtures, waste separation and recycling systems.","People":"Household occupants, environmental agencies, and policymakers.","Owner":"Energy and water conservation initiatives, waste management programs, and environmental policy implementation."},{"Description":"Elevated ozone pollution and changes in NOx concentrations in cities, impacting air quality and health.","Impact":"Health risks from elevated ozone pollution, uncertain long-term environmental impact, and potential respiratory issues.","Mitigation":"Implementing air quality monitoring, emission controls, and sustainable urban planning.","Technologies":"Air quality monitoring systems, emission reduction technologies, and sustainable urban development practices.","People":"Urban residents, especially those susceptible to respiratory issues, environmental agencies, and urban planners.","Owner":"City authorities, environmental agencies, and urban development organizations."}]}
